sense.name: an organized group of people with a shared cause
sense.commentary: CAUCUS[+group][+social][+people][+shared][+cause] Note: usually refers to a political organization
sense.examples: The caucus met with representatives from the steel industry. The president expressed willingness to speak with caucus members.

sense.name: a private decision-making meeting of an interest group
sense.commentary: CAUCUS[+activity][+meeting][+private][+decision_making] Note: usually refers to a closed political meeting
sense.examples: A new chairman of the Democratic party was picked at the last caucus. The senate caucus ended sometime after midnight.
